scriptLines.text: A whoop.  A howl.  Tinkling, and a low grumble that's simultaneously far-off and immediate.  Your heart beats in your chest - the alien sounds surround you and permeate your skin and leave you feeling deeply unsettled.

The fey forest is untread by most mortals - its wonders are many, but its dangers even greater.  Strange creatures peek out from holes dug into giant mushroom stalks, their myriad eyes tracing your movements unblinking, with the largest of those eyes disappearing into obscurity whenever your gaze catches theirs.

That you are being watched isn't what concerns you.  As you hear the cracks of broken twigs underfoot, it is the notion that you are being -hunted- that causes you to tremble each time you approach a blind corner.
After passing a massive mushroom, you spot what appears to be a small trail, with an "entrance" of sorts between two tall stalks.

A string of... teeth, it looks, sharp and pointed, has been hung between them, and in the gap between said rows of teeth is a simple wooden sign, carved from some tree that is certainly not of this particular forest.
"KEEP OUT" it reads, rather forebodingly.

Deciding that whoever wrote the sign probably had a good reason for doing so - either to keep passers-by out of dangerous territory or to warn them about trespassing, you continue on the main trail through the strange forest, still visibly shaken.
You ignore the warning - your curiosity getting the better of you.  You pass underneath the sign and the string of teeth, and begin following the small trail.
It's small in more ways than one, not only is the path barely cleared at all, but you have to stoop under several mushroom caps to even continue on.
If not for the bioluminescence of some of the mushrooms, you'd be cloaked in darkness - the growth is denser here than on the main path.
Eyes still follow you as you go, and you start to hear more and more intimidating sounds.  You shake your head, trying to get ahold of yourself.

You home in the exact location of the noise you heard, and your eyes lock on a small, diminuitive figure.  They quickly dive into the undergrowth, trying to break your line of vision, but your keen senses are able to track them regardless of where they go.
They dart through the underbrush and position themselves nearby, unaware that you still know exactly where they are.  They try to nick you with their spear, thrusting out from the growth.
You manage to dodge the tip and grab the shaft of the spear!
You're able to yank the spear away from them!  Disarmed, they retreat back into the growth.
You struggle with the spear, but relinquish it before they can cut you with it.  They won't be trying that again, you think, as they retreat back into the growth.
You manage to dodge the spear, and they retreat back into the growth.
You're still too slow to dodge it; it stabs into your chest.  You take 5 damage. You watch as they retreat into the growth.
